stories.text:
Are there any existing good TTS plugins optimized for Wikiepdia? Or any voice-actors on youtube etc. that might be into something like this? I have tried existing TTS like WaveNet on wikipedia, but it's just painful to hear. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GBKL8pr33gI&list=PL5auFEufvR_D-NMNOOce9P5yfebayuvV1&index=1
stories.title: Wikipedia to Audio

stories.text:
I am asking because I have noticed that as I build better landing pages for my MVPs I get judged more harshly.
This got me thinking if there is a way in which having a not particularly attractive landing page might get people to approach the product in a different way.
stories.title: Ask HN: Is there an “uncanny valley” effect with startup MVPs
